Question: This person was ordered to "act defensively or offensively" as he thought best.
Hints: The state of this person is the only state to be named after a United States President.
The first statue to show this person on horseback was dedicated in 1856 and is located in Manhattan's Union Square.
This person was elected President as the unanimous choice of the 69 electors in 1788, and he served two terms in office.
